resources.string: FFmpeg4Android shows how easy it is for every application to run FFMpeg commands.
Simple example using a AsyncTask without progress bar.\n When using this technique, you will not be able to stop the operation while its running.
Simple progress bar example with stop support (you can cancel the transcoding when its running).

Progress bar with notification example (and stop / cancel support).\n The notification will work only on Android 4 or above.\n To support notifications on older versions, use the Android support library
ffmpeg -i out1.mp4 -i out2.mp4 -i out3.mp4 -i out4.mp4 -filter_complex '[0:0][1:0][2:0][3:0]concat=n=4:v=0:a=1[out]' -map '[out]' output.mp4
